channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: A year on, protesters in Tbilisi, Georgia refuse to accept pivot to Russia
item.description: Protesters in Tbilisi, Georgia mark a year of unrest, accusing the government of ditching Europe for closer ties with Russia.
item.content:encoded: Protesters in Tbilisi, Georgia mark a year of unrest, accusing the government of ditching Europe for closer ties with Russia.
item.dc:creator: Robin Forestier-Walker

item.title: Yves Jarvis drops deluxe edition of 'All Cylinders'
item.description: Canadian musician Yves Jarvis has released a deluxe edition of his Polaris Prize–winning album 'All Cylinders'.
item.content:encoded: Canadian musician Yves Jarvis has released a deluxe edition of his Polaris Prize–winning album 'All Cylinders'.
item.dc:creator: Kira Wakeam

item.title: Inside the push to bring mental health care into American mosques
item.description: American Muslim communities are working to reduce stigma around therapy by bringing mental health services into mosques and making counseling easier to access.
item.content:encoded: American Muslim communities are working to reduce stigma around therapy by bringing mental health services into mosques and making counseling easier to access.
item.dc:creator: Nargis Rahman

item.title: Putin finds a warm welcome in India
item.description: Professor Šumit Ganguly, Director of the Huntington Program at Stanford's Hoover Institution, says Putin's visit to India reflects ongoing ties despite U.S. pressure.
item.content:encoded: Professor Šumit Ganguly, Director of the Huntington Program at Stanford's Hoover Institution, says Putin's visit to India reflects ongoing ties despite U.S. pressure.
item.dc:creator: Ahmad Damen

item.title: Gaza students killed while waiting for visas to study abroad
item.description: Gaza students with scholarships to Canada say visa delays have left many stranded, and some were killed waiting to leave.
item.content:encoded: Gaza students with scholarships to Canada say visa delays have left many stranded, and some were killed waiting to leave.
item.dc:creator: Abu Bakr Bashir

item.title: How NPR keeps reporting on the Pentagon after being barred from the building
item.description: NPR's Tom Bowman says his decades of roaming Pentagon halls ended after NPR refused to sign a new policy requiring reporters to wait for official information releases - but his reporting hasn't slowed at all.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Tom Bowman says his decades of roaming Pentagon halls ended after NPR refused to sign a new policy requiring reporters to wait for official information releases - but his reporting hasn't slowed at all.
item.dc:creator: Tom Bowman

item.title: Senator Warner calls for Defense Secretary Hegseth's resignation after classified strike briefing
item.description: Senator Mark Warner says video of the Caribbean attack reveals survivors still on the wreck when the second strike came.
item.content:encoded: Senator Mark Warner says video of the Caribbean attack reveals survivors still on the wreck when the second strike came.
item.dc:creator: Avery Keatley

item.title: West Virginians question National Guard deployments after attack on 2 of their own
item.description: Army Specialist Sarah Beckstrom was fatally shot in Washington, D.C., while Air Force Staff Sgt. Andrew Wolfe was seriously wounded. Trump says the deployments are necessary to fight crime, but others disagree.
item.content:encoded:
Army Specialist Sarah Beckstrom was fatally shot in Washington, D.C., while Air Force Staff Sgt. Andrew Wolfe was seriously wounded. Trump says the deployments are necessary to fight crime, but others disagree.

(Image credit: Michael A. McCoy for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: This week in Washington
item.description: It was a busy week in Washington, from foreign policy to Congressional redistricting and another special election. NPR's Domenico Montanaro and Tamara Keith break down the big news of the week.
item.content:encoded: It was a busy week in Washington, from foreign policy to Congressional redistricting and another special election. NPR's Domenico Montanaro and Tamara Keith break down the big news of the week.
item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith

item.title: The Michelin Guide honors three cheesesteak joints in Philadelphia
item.description: Some Philadelphians are cheesed off at the Michelin restaurant ratings team for an honor bestowed on some local cheesesteak restaurants.
item.content:encoded: Some Philadelphians are cheesed off at the Michelin restaurant ratings team for an honor bestowed on some local cheesesteak restaurants.
item.dc:creator: Buffy Gorrilla
